subject: Education
title: AI in Education: What's Next?
description: A 60-second lesson on AI in Education: What's Next?.

hook.text: An AI tutor adapts in real time to what you don't understand. Teachers can't do that for 30 kids.

buildup.text: Adaptive learning software personalizes pace, difficulty, and content per student.

discovery.text: Bloom's 2-sigma problem showed that one-on-one tutoring boosts students two grades. AI aims to scale that.

twist.text: Without human connection, AI tutoring risks creating isolated, dependent learners.

climax.text: The future likely blends AI efficiency with human mentorship and community.

punchline.text: The best teacher might be a human who uses AI, not an AI that replaces one.

quiz.question: What is Bloom's 2-sigma problem?
options: One-on-one tutoring improves students by two standard deviations but can't scale
AI tutors are twice as effective as human teachers
Students need two years of extra study to catch up
